title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Basics of MEMS and microfabrication, Basics of NEMS and nanomanipulation. Smart sensors and actuators. Micro pH and temperatures sensors fabricated on CMOS technology. CAD for sensors.Smart materials: Electroactive polymers, Shape memory alloy, Magnetorheological and Electrorheological fluids, hysteresis in smart materials, Sensor Modelling and control: Origin, Simulation and Modelling of smart sensors- static and dynamic (FD, FEM), Feedback mechanism and active control. Signal conditioning and interfaces for sensor: IEEE 1451 standard for smart transducer interfacing, signal conditioning and conversion, calibration, linearization and basic sensor communications.Distributed and multidimensional sensing techniques: Tomograhic sensing technique and measurement Ã¢ÂÂ process and medical, sensor networking Ã¢ÂÂ data fusion and 2-D, 3-D measurement.Biosensors: mono and multi enzyme biosensors, enzyme based affinity biosensors, electrochemical immunosensors, Cell and tissue based sensors, biochips and biosensor arrays. Application of Biosensors: Clinical application (glucose monitoring), Implantable sensing (drug monitoring), process control (food monitoring).
